intro: Polygonum baltistanicum, commonly known as the Baltistan knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and edible seeds. This species is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its mountainous habitat.
